page.title: 19Housing and buildings
page.content: Wysall contains examples of terraced houses, some of which have been moder- nised, and some combined to form larger dwellings. There is one large farmhouse of some antiquity, being a listed building, but now fallen into disrepair and unoccupied, possibly because of difficult access via a muddy yard. There are modern detached family houses, bungalows and other single storey buildings. Building materials are brick, with slate roof- ing on older buildings; modern build- ings are roofed with man-made tiles and occupy spare land (in-fill sites) in the village. Widmerpool has terr- aced farm cottages and other establi- shed buildings, including the former school, which have been modernised and converted to single dwellings. Modern property is detached 1- or 2-storied. All properties are owner occupied.
